Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, fabric is black in section, interior spotted with a brown resinous substance, exterior covered with a brown slip and remains of nine lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now worn in places, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.214)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36497) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36497)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 372 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13543 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
